**U.S. Route 42** (**US 42**) is an east–west [United States
highway](/wiki/United_States_highway "United States highway") that runs
southwest-northeast for 355 miles (571 km) from [Louisville,
Kentucky](/wiki/Louisville,_Kentucky "Louisville, Kentucky") to
[Cleveland](/wiki/Cleveland "Cleveland"), [Ohio](/wiki/Ohio "Ohio"). The route
has several names including **Pearl Road** from Cleveland to
[Medina](/wiki/Medina,_Ohio "Medina, Ohio") in [Northeast
Ohio](/wiki/Northeast_Ohio "Northeast Ohio"), **Reading Road** in
[Cincinnati](/wiki/Cincinnati "Cincinnati"), **Cincinnati and Lebanon Pike**
in southwestern Ohio and **Brownsboro Road** in Louisville. Traveling east,
the highway ends in [downtown Cleveland](/wiki/Downtown_Cleveland "Downtown
Cleveland"), Ohio; and traveling west it ends in Louisville.

[Interstate 71](/wiki/Interstate_71 "Interstate 71") fully supplanted US 42 as
an interurban highway in the early 1960s, relegating US 42 to its current role
as an ordinary town-to-town surface road. Additionally, I-71 passes through
[Columbus](/wiki/Columbus,_Ohio "Columbus, Ohio"), where US 42 avoids Columbus
completely. It remains intact as a route; no part of it has ever been diverted
to any Interstate highway. It is not the "parent" of any US route with a
related number.

In spite of its even number, US 42 is posted north-south in Ohio.[2]

## Route
description[[edit](/w/index.php?title=U.S._Route_42&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Route description")]

### Kentucky[[edit](/w/index.php?title=U.S._Route_42&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Kentucky")]

U.S. Route 42 starts in [Louisville, Kentucky](/wiki/Louisville,_Kentucky
"Louisville, Kentucky"), heading northeast through
[Prospect](/wiki/Prospect,_Kentucky "Prospect, Kentucky") on the [Oldham
County](/wiki/Oldham_County,_Kentucky "Oldham County, Kentucky") and
[Jefferson County](/wiki/Jefferson_County,_Kentucky "Jefferson County,
Kentucky") line. From here US 42 is a two lane road passing through the
northern KY hills paralleling between [Interstate 71](/wiki/Interstate_71
"Interstate 71") and the [Ohio River](/wiki/Ohio_River "Ohio River"). Next, it
passes through Goshen and [North Oldham High
School](/wiki/North_Oldham_High_School "North Oldham High School"), which sits
off to its north side. U.S. 42 continues through Oldham County into [Trimble
County](/wiki/Trimble_County,_Kentucky "Trimble County, Kentucky"). In
[Bedford](/wiki/Bedford,_Kentucky "Bedford, Kentucky") US 42 intersects with
[US 421](/wiki/U.S._Route_421 "U.S. Route 421") and is concurrent through
downtown. The route still heading northeast crosses into [Carroll
County](/wiki/Carroll_County,_Kentucky "Carroll County, Kentucky") prior to
crossing the [Kentucky River](/wiki/Kentucky_River "Kentucky River") and
entering [Carrollton](/wiki/Carrollton,_Kentucky "Carrollton, Kentucky"). US
42 follows northeast along the south bank of the Ohio River passing Markland
Lock and Dam and KY 1039 [Markland Dam Bridge](/wiki/Markland_Dam_Bridge
"Markland Dam Bridge") which connects between [Kentucky
Speedway](/wiki/Kentucky_Speedway "Kentucky Speedway") and
[Indiana](/wiki/Indiana "Indiana"). Heading east US 42 parallels the Ohio
River passing through [Warsaw](/wiki/Warsaw,_Kentucky "Warsaw, Kentucky"),
[Gallatin County](/wiki/Gallatin_County,_Kentucky "Gallatin County, Kentucky")
about 5 miles (8.0 km) prior to intersecting with [U.S. Route
127](/wiki/U.S._Route_127 "U.S. Route 127") starting an extended concurrency.
US 127 heads south toward [Glencoe](/wiki/Glencoe,_Kentucky "Glencoe,
Kentucky"), [Owenton](/wiki/Owenton,_Kentucky "Owenton, Kentucky"), and
eventually [Frankfort](/wiki/Frankfort,_Kentucky "Frankfort, Kentucky").

From the intersection with US 127, US 42 turns away from the Ohio River bank.
US 42 enters [Boone County](/wiki/Boone_County,_Kentucky "Boone County,
Kentucky") about 2.25 miles (3.62 km) prior to intersecting with the western
terminus of [KY 14](/wiki/Kentucky_Route_14 "Kentucky Route 14"). Continuing
North US 42-127 in about 6 miles (9.7 km) intersects Beaver Road [KY
338](/wiki/Kentucky_Route_338 "Kentucky Route 338") creating a [wrong-way
concurrency](/wiki/Wrong-way_concurrency "Wrong-way concurrency") between U.S.
127 and KY 338: when going north, drivers are traveling east on U.S. 42, north
on U.S. 127, and south on Kentucky 338. This continues for less than a mile
until it intersects with Richwood Pike where KY 338 splits off continuing
south.

Continuing north for several miles the US 42-127 intersects with [KY
536](/wiki/Kentucky_Route_536 "Kentucky Route 536") (Mount Zion Road). Prior
to KY 536 [Ryle High School](/wiki/Ryle_High_School "Ryle High School") sits
on the road's west side. Just south of Ryle, U.S. 42 turns from a two-lane
country road to a five-lane road. US 42 passes through
[Union](/wiki/Union,_Kentucky "Union, Kentucky") prior to continuing to the
northeast with U.S. 127. After a couple of miles, it crosses [Interstate
71](/wiki/Interstate_71 "Interstate 71")/[Interstate 75](/wiki/Interstate_75
"Interstate 75"). Entering [Florence](/wiki/Florence,_Kentucky "Florence,
Kentucky") US 42 intersects with [KY 842](/wiki/Kentucky_Route_842 "Kentucky
Route 842") and [KY 237](/wiki/Kentucky_Route_237 "Kentucky Route 237").
Within Florence [U.S. Route 25](/wiki/U.S._Route_25_in_Kentucky "U.S. Route 25
in Kentucky") [Dixie Highway](/wiki/Dixie_Highway "Dixie Highway") joins in a
concurrency with US 42-127 which takes on the name Dixie Highway.[3] After
crossing briefly into [Elsmere](/wiki/Elsmere,_Kentucky "Elsmere, Kentucky"),
the route enters [Erlanger](/wiki/Erlanger,_Kentucky "Erlanger, Kentucky").
U.S. 42 becomes almost entirely a commercial road for the duration of its
length in Erlanger. Prior to leaving Erlanger, U.S. 42 becomes narrower and
more congested after it crosses [KY 236](/wiki/Kentucky_Route_236 "Kentucky
Route 236").

U.S. 42 is primarily a commercial road prior to crossing under
[I-275](/wiki/Interstate_275_\(Ohio%E2%80%93Indiana%E2%80%93Kentucky\)
"Interstate 275 \(Ohio–Indiana–Kentucky\)") and proceeds to turn back into an
almost purely residential road with a few exceptions while going north. The
route intersects with [KY 1303](/wiki/Kentucky_Route_1303 "Kentucky Route
1303") (Turkeyfoot Road) northern terminus. The [Crestview
Hills](/wiki/Crestview_Hills,_Kentucky "Crestview Hills, Kentucky") town
center lies just south of I-275 on the east side of the road, between Dixie
Highway and Turkeyfoot Road. [Dixie Heights High
School](/wiki/Dixie_Heights_High_School "Dixie Heights High School") is less
than a mile down the road on the western side. Two intersections later US 42
is joined with KY 371 for about 500 feet (150 m). After crossing I-71/I-75
again the road heads in a northeast direction closely parallel to I-71/I-75.
As it heads north U.S. 42 starts off mostly as a residential road, turning
more and more into a commercial road.

As it winds down from the suburbs into [Covington](/wiki/Covington,_Kentucky
"Covington, Kentucky") the highway's name changes from Dixie Highway to Pike
Street prior to crossing I-71/I-75 again. US 25-42-127 turns left on Main St
heading north and crossing [KY 8](/wiki/Kentucky_Route_8 "Kentucky Route 8").
U.S. 42 crosses into Ohio from Covington on the [Clay Wade Bailey
Bridge](/wiki/Clay_Wade_Bailey_Bridge "Clay Wade Bailey Bridge"), together
with [US 25](/wiki/U.S._Route_25_in_Kentucky "U.S. Route 25 in Kentucky") and
[US 127](/wiki/U.S._Route_127 "U.S. Route 127").

### Ohio[[edit](/w/index.php?title=U.S._Route_42&action=edit&section=3 "Edit
section: Ohio")]

U.S. 42 crosses into Ohio from Covington on the [Clay Wade Bailey
Bridge](/wiki/Clay_Wade_Bailey_Bridge "Clay Wade Bailey Bridge"), together
with US 127, into [Cincinnati](/wiki/Cincinnati "Cincinnati"), [Hamilton
County](/wiki/Hamilton_County,_Ohio "Hamilton County, Ohio"). In Ohio the
route is classified as 59.3% rural and 40.7% urban with only 1.1 miles (1.8
km) coded as freeway (while running concurrently with US 23 in Delaware) of
241.8 miles (389.1 km) total.[4] While heading Northeast out of Cincinnati US
42 parallels between [I-71](/wiki/Interstate_71 "Interstate 71") and
[I-75](/wiki/Interstate_75_in_Ohio "Interstate 75 in Ohio") intersecting with
[I-275](/wiki/Interstate_275_\(Ohio\) "Interstate 275 \(Ohio\)") prior to
leaving Hamilton County. US 42 continues through
[Butler](/wiki/Butler_County,_OH "Butler County, OH"),
[Warren](/wiki/Warren_County,_OH "Warren County, OH"),
[Greene](/wiki/Greene_County,_OH "Greene County, OH"),
[Clark](/wiki/Clark_County,_OH "Clark County, OH"),
[Madison](/wiki/Madison_County,_OH "Madison County, OH"),
[Union](/wiki/Union_County,_OH "Union County, OH"),
[Delaware](/wiki/Delaware_County,_OH "Delaware County, OH"),
[Morrow](/wiki/Morrow_County,_OH "Morrow County, OH"),
[Richland](/wiki/Richland_County,_OH "Richland County, OH"),
[Ashland](/wiki/Ashland_County,_OH "Ashland County, OH"),
[Wayne](/wiki/Wayne_County,_OH "Wayne County, OH") and
[Medina](/wiki/Medina_County,_OH "Medina County, OH") Counties prior to
reaching its terminus in [Cleveland](/wiki/Cleveland "Cleveland"), [Cuyahoga
County](/wiki/Cuyahoga_County,_Ohio "Cuyahoga County, Ohio").[5] The route
barely enters Butler and Wayne Counties with about 3 miles (4.8 km) in each.

The portion of U.S. 42 in Warren County between [Lebanon](/wiki/Lebanon,_Ohio
"Lebanon, Ohio") and [Waynesville](/wiki/Waynesville,_Ohio "Waynesville,
Ohio") is designated "Sergeant Brian Dulle Memorial Highway",[6] in honor of a
Warren County Sheriff's deputy who was struck and killed along U.S. 42 on May
10, 2011 by a stolen car, while he was laying out [stop
sticks](/wiki/Spike_strip "Spike strip") to catch the driver.[7]

Major cities along the route are [Xenia](/wiki/Xenia,_OH "Xenia, OH"),
[London](/wiki/London,_OH "London, OH"), [Delaware](/wiki/Delaware,_OH
"Delaware, OH"), [Mansfield](/wiki/Mansfield,_OH "Mansfield, OH"),
[Ashland](/wiki/Ashland,_OH "Ashland, OH") and [Medina](/wiki/Medina,_OH
"Medina, OH") prior to reaching the Cleveland Metropolitan area. In London US
42 intersects with [I-70](/wiki/Interstate_70_in_Ohio "Interstate 70 in
Ohio"). Other than a short concurrency at each end, in Delaware are the only
other two concurrency with US routes. Entering Delaware from the south US 42
runs concurrent with [US 23](/wiki/U.S._Route_23_in_Ohio "U.S. Route 23 in
Ohio") in Delaware until the junction with US 36 which it follows east for
about .25 miles (0.40 km) before turning back to the north. The 1.1 miles (1.8
km) concurrence with US 23 is the only stretch of US 42 that is categorized as
a limited access freeway in Ohio.[4]

Heading into Cuyahoga County at [Strongsville](/wiki/Strongsville,_OH
"Strongsville, OH"), U.S. 42 intersects [I-80](/wiki/Interstate_80_in_Ohio
"Interstate 80 in Ohio"), the [Ohio Turnpike](/wiki/Ohio_Turnpike "Ohio
Turnpike"), and continues through [Middleburg
Heights](/wiki/Middleburg_Heights,_Ohio "Middleburg Heights, Ohio"), [Parma
Heights](/wiki/Parma_Heights,_Ohio "Parma Heights, Ohio"), and
[Parma](/wiki/Parma,_Ohio "Parma, Ohio") heading into Cleveland and is known
locally as Pearl Road. US 42 continues north intersecting with I-71 and nearby
exits to [I-90](/wiki/Interstate_90_in_Ohio "Interstate 90 in Ohio"). The
route is part of the [Ohio & Erie Canalway Scenic
Byway](/wiki/Ohio_%26_Erie_Canalway_Scenic_Byway "Ohio & Erie Canalway Scenic
Byway") while continuing north on West 25th. At this point on the route the
road is a business district surrounded by varying business and residents of
the [Ohio City](/wiki/Ohio_City,_Cleveland "Ohio City, Cleveland")
neighborhood. Along this stretch of the route, can be found many historic
buildings, including the [West Side Market](/wiki/West_Side_Market "West Side
Market"). The last stretch of US 42 is a concurrency with [US
6](/wiki/US_Route_6 "US Route 6").

The eastern/northern end of U.S. 42 finds its terminus at the intersection of
Superior Ave. and Ontario St. in the middle of Public Square in downtown
Cleveland. This intersection also serves as the western terminus of [US
322](/wiki/U.S._Route_322_in_Ohio "U.S. Route 322 in Ohio") coming from the
east on Superior as well as the western termini of [US
422](/wiki/U.S._Route_422_in_Ohio "U.S. Route 422 in Ohio"), [SR
14](/wiki/Ohio_State_Route_14 "Ohio State Route 14"), and [SR
87](/wiki/Ohio_State_Route_87 "Ohio State Route 87") and the northern terminus
of [SR 8](/wiki/Ohio_State_Route_8 "Ohio State Route 8") coming from the south
on Ontario.
